info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 5:06AM CDT until June 30 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing or expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Jewell and Smith.
* WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, and possibly along area creeks and some rural county roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated very heavy rain in the process of moving out of the area, but a widespread 2 to 4 inches have already fallen over the last few hours, and up to 1 more inch is still possible before rain ends this morning. Mainly minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Prairie Creek, Limestone Creek, Ash Creek, West Limestone Creek, Middle Buffalo Creek, West Buffalo Creek, East Fork Big Timber Creek, Spring Creek, West Oak Creek, Buffalo Creek, West Marsh Creek, Oak Creek, Middle Limestone Creek, Granite Creek, East Oak Creek, Lindley Creek, East Buffalo Creek, Marsh Creek, Plum Creek and Little Oak Creek.
- Some locations that could experience flooding include... Mankato, Jewell, Formoso, Ionia, Randall and Montrose. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING
